page.title: 01Edge of Bodmin Moor
page.content: Small roads wind up and down through moorland that stretches tothe horizon. Granite lays among the heather where wild ponies sheep and cattle graze. This area is thinly populated people living mainly in small villages in old cottage built of granite and scattered small holdings. The aera is dominated by a 450 foot high television mast on top of 1200 Caradon Hill. The moors aroun are dotted with disused tin mines prehistoric hut circles and standing stones which attract a small number of tourist. Few of the inhabitants are native Cornish these being the small holders ad hill farmers. Wtih the except of the few local shopkeepers and publicans, most working people commute mainly by car out of the area. It is an area of high unemployment.
